intro: Galium obtusum subsp. filifolium, commonly known as silky bedstraw, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to North America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, opposite leaves. The leaves are typically covered in fine, silky hairs, giving the plant its common name. It produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers in late spring to early summer. This subspecies is often found in moist, open habitats such as meadows, woodlands, and stream banks.
